start.title: demo of Interactive Virtual Math
start.p1: In this application you get one assignment.
start.p2: This assignment will help you to understand, visualise and draw the relations between variables in a graph.

intro.p1: You are now going to draw a graph of a dynamic relationship. You can do this on the screen using a mouse, stylus or finger.
intro.p2: Once you are satisfied with your graph you hand it in. You will receive specific feedback on your work.

assignments.description: Imagine that this bottle is filled with water; the water flows at a constant speed.
assignments.questions_li1: Sketch a graph in which you draw the height of the water in the bottle compared to the amount of water in the bottle.

compare.title: Compare and hand in
compare.p: Compare the charts. Are you satisfied? If so, hand in your work.

feedback.title: Feedback
feedback.label_reward: This is the shape of the vase matching your graph
feedback.switch_0: You have now finished the assignment. In order to improve yourself you have to link the relationship between the height and amount of the water and take into account the shape of the vase.
feedback.switch_1: You have now finished the assignment. In order to improve yourself you do not only need to link the relationship between the height and amount of the water, but also take into account the shape of the vase.
feedback.switch_2: You have now finished the assignment. You linked the relationship between the height and amount of water in both situations, and also took into account the shape of the vase.
feedback.without_help: You have not used any of the help offered
feedback.some_help: You have not used all the help offered
feedback.all_help: You have used all the help offered
feedback.applied_help: but you did try to apply it
